message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.PF 

Reasoning: 

1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on queueing systems in wireless networks, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses scheduling policies for optimizing delay in queueing systems, which is related to information theory and communication systems. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a class of scheduling policies for queueing systems, which can be considered as a control problem. 
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with scheduling policies for a single server serving multiple queues, which can be seen as a distributed computing problem. 
5. cs.PF (Performance) - The paper focuses on optimizing delay performance in queueing systems, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
